intro: Navarretia rigidula, commonly known as the hardstem navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. Navarretia rigidula is known for its ability to thrive in dry, sunny conditions and is often found in coastal and inland areas. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
